meanings.definition: To introduce (a substance) into the body by means of a syringe.
meanings.sent1: The nurse will inject the medicine into your arm.
meanings.sent2: Doctors often inject vaccines to protect us from diseases.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally tried to inject ketchup into my coffee instead of sugar!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter injected a sense of joy into the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush seemed to inject life into the canvas.

meanings.definition: To introduce (a quality or feeling) into a situation or environment.
meanings.sent1: His positive attitude can inject energy into the team.
meanings.sent2: Music has the power to inject emotions into our hearts.
meanings.sent3: The clown tried to inject humor into the serious meeting.
meanings.sent4: Her smile injected warmth into the cold room.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays inject brightness into the morning sky.

meanings.definition: To interject (a comment or remark) into a conversation.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't help but inject a joke into the discussion.
meanings.sent2: It's rude to constantly inject your opinions into every conversation.
meanings.sent3: The parrot decided to inject its own thoughts into the conversation.
meanings.sent4: His loud sneeze injected a moment of surprise into the quiet room.
meanings.sent5: The comedian knew how to inject humor at just the right moment.
